member.name: T:FreeTextBoxControls.AssemblyResourceHandler

summary.para: The AssemblyResourceHandler class is an http handler that is able to retrieve embedded resources from a particular assembly. It will stream this resource back to the requesting client. The embedded resource must be reachable for this handler. For this an assembly-level attribute must be specified. This attribute specifies the name of the resource file with extension and the content type. The latter can be specified as a literal string or as one of the static values.
If you do not specify the attribute, an will be thrown when requesting the resource. The resource can be retrieved through a special URL, which can be build using the method.

member.name: M:FreeTextBoxControls.AssemblyResourceHandler.ProcessRequest(System.Web.HttpContext)
member.summary: Process the request from the user

member.name: M:FreeTextBoxControls.AssemblyResourceHandler.Load(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Load an image from a given assembly
member.param: The name of the assembly to load
The name of the resource to load
Will be set to the content type as specified by the

member.name: M:FreeTextBoxControls.AssemblyResourceHandler.GetWebResourceUrl(System.Type,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Composes a full url to be used when referencing a resource of this type and with the specified name.

member.returns: Url to retrieve this particular resource.

member.name: P:FreeTextBoxControls.AssemblyResourceHandler.IsReusable
member.summary: This handler is marked as reusable and always return true.

member.name: T:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.CaseFolding
member.summary: SGML is case insensitive, so here you can choose between converting to lower case or upper case tags. "None" means that the case is left alone, except that end tags will be folded to match the start tags.

member.name: T:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.HWStack
member.summary: This stack maintains a high water mark for allocated objects so the client can reuse the objects in the stack to reduce memory allocations, this is used to maintain current state of the parser for element stack, and attributes in each element.

member.name: T:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.Attribute
member.summary: This class represents an attribute. The AttDef is assigned from a validation process, and is used to provide default values.

member.name: M:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.Attribute.Reset(System.String,System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Attribute objects are reused during parsing to reduce memory allocations, hence the Reset method.

member.name: T:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.Node
M:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.Node.Reset(System.String,System.Xml.XmlNodeType,System.String)
member.summary: Attribute objects are reused during parsing to reduce memory allocations, hence the Reset method.

member.name: T:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.SgmlReader
member.summary: SgmlReader is an XmlReader API over any SGML document (including built in support for HTML).

member.name: M:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.SgmlReader.SetBaseUri(System.String)
member.summary: The base Uri is used to resolve relative Uri's like the SystemLiteral and Href properties. This is a method because BaseURI is a read-only property on the base XmlReader class.

member.name: P:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.SgmlReader.Dtd
member.summary: Specify the SgmlDtd object directly. This allows you to cache the Dtd and share it across multipl SgmlReaders. To load a DTD from a URL use the SystemLiteral property.

member.name: P:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.SgmlReader.DocType
member.summary: The name of root element specified in the DOCTYPE tag.

member.name: P:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.SgmlReader.PublicIdentifier
member.summary: The PUBLIC identifier in the DOCTYPE tag

member.name: P:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.SgmlReader.SystemLiteral
member.summary: The SYSTEM literal in the DOCTYPE tag identifying the location of the DTD.

member.name: P:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.SgmlReader.InternalSubset
member.summary: The DTD internal subset in the DOCTYPE tag

member.name: P:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.SgmlReader.InputStream
member.summary: The input stream containing SGML data to parse. You must specify this property or the Href property before calling Read().

member.name: P:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.SgmlReader.WebProxy
member.summary: Sometimes you need to specify a proxy server in order to load data via HTTP from outside the firewall. For example: "itgproxy:80".

member.name: P:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.SgmlReader.Href
member.summary: Specify the location of the input SGML document as a URL.

member.name: P:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.Sgml.SgmlReader.StripDocType
member.summary: Whether to strip out the DOCTYPE tag from the output (default true)

member.summary: DTD validation errors are written to this stream.

member.name: T:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.MsAjaxProxy
member.summary:
This is a proxy object for the Page.ClientScript and MS Ajax ScriptManager object that can operate when MS Ajax is not present. Because MS Ajax may not be available accessing the methods directly is not possible and we are required to indirectly reference client script methods through this class.
This class should be invoked at the Control's start up and be used to replace all calls Page.ClientScript. Scriptmanager calls are made through Reflection

member.name: M:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.MsAjaxProxy.#ctor
member.summary: No public constructor - use ClientScriptProxy.Current to get an instance to ensure you once have one instance per page active.

member.name: M:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.MsAjaxProxy.IsMsAjax
member.summary:
Checks to see if MS Ajax is registered with the current Web application.
Note: Method is static so it can be directly accessed from anywhere. If you use the IsMsAjax property to check the value this method fires only once per application.

member.name: M:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.MsAjaxProxy.IsScriptManagerOnPage(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Checks to see if a script manager is on the page

member.name: M:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.MsAjaxProxy.RegisterClientScriptResource(System.Web.UI.Control,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a WebResource or ScriptResource URL for script resources that are to be embedded as script includes.

member.name: M:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.MsAjaxProxy.RegisterClientScriptBlock(System.Web.UI.Control,System.Type,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers a client script block in the page.

member.name: M:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.MsAjaxProxy.RegisterStartupScript(System.Web.UI.Control,System.Type,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers a startup code snippet that gets placed at the bottom of the page

member.name: P:FreeTextBoxControls.Support.MsAjaxProxy.Current
member.summary: Current instance of this class which should always be used to access this object. There are no public constructors to ensure the reference is used as a Singleton to further ensure that all scripts are written to the same clientscript manager.

member.name: T:FreeTextBoxControls.FreeTextBox
member.summary: The no. 1 free ASP.NET HTML editor for IE, Firefox, Opera, Safari, and Chrome.
member.remarks: Supports IE, Firefox, Opera, Safari, and Chrome. The Toolbar can be customized in several ways. 1) By setting the string with appopriate and names, 2) Procedurally, by setting AutoGenerateToolbarsFromString=false and adding ASP.NET code, 3) in codebehind, 4) by inherting from or

example.code:
-- webform.aspx ---------------------------- <%@ Register TagPrefix="FTB" Assembly="FreeTextBox" Namespace="FreeTextBoxControls" %> <html> <head> </head> <body> <form runat="server"> <FTB:FreeTextBox id="FreeTextBox1" runat="server" /> </form> </body> </html>
-- web.config ------------------------------- <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <system.web> <httpHandlers> <add verb="GET" path="FtbWebResource.axd" type="FreeTextBoxControls.AssemblyResourceHandler, FreeTextBox" /> </httpHandlers> </system.web> </configuration>

member.name: P:FreeTextBoxControls.FreeTextBox.ToolbarLayout
member.summary: A string of buttons used to create the toolbar. Use commas (,) to separate items. A pipe (|) will insert a separator and a semicolon (;) will start a new Toolbar. Possible values are ParagraphMenu, FontFacesMenu, FontSizesMenu, FontForeColorsMenu, FontForeColorPicker, FontBackColorsMenu, FontBackColorPicker, Bold, Italic, Underline, Strikethrough, Superscript, Subscript, CreateLink, Unlink, RemoveFormat, JustifyLeft, JustifyRight, JustifyCenter, JustifyFull, BulletedList, NumberedList, Indent, Outdent, Cut, Copy, Paste, Delete, Undo, Redo, Print, Save, SymbolsMenu, StylesMenu, InsertHtmlMenu, InsertRule, InsertDate, InsertTime, ieSpellCheck, NetSpell, WordClean, InsertImageFromGallery, InsertTable, InsertTableRowBelow, InsertTableRowAbove, DeleteTableRow, InsertTableColumnBelow, InsertTableColumnAbove, DeleteTableColumn, InsertForm, InsertForm,InsertTextBox,InsertTextArea,InsertRadioButton,InsertCheckBox,InsertDropDownList,InsertButton, InsertDiv, InsertImageFromGallery
